intro: Canthium marojejyense, commonly known as the Marojejy spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
